pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:0.5.eng: The training rule on during the rainy season

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo antovassaṃ cārikaṃ caranti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.2.eng: the nuns went wandering during the rainy season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo antovassaṃ cārikaṃ carissanti haritāni tiṇāni ca sammaddantā, ekindriyaṃ jīvaṃ viheṭhentā, bahū khuddake pāṇe saṅghātaṃ āpādentā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns go wandering during the rainy season? They are trampling down the green grass, harming one-sensed life, and destroying many small beings.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.7.eng: “How can nuns go wandering during the rainy season?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo antovassaṃ cārikaṃ carantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo antovassaṃ cārikaṃ carissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.14.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī antovassaṃ cārikaṃ careyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun goes wandering during the rainy season, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.6.pli: purimaṃ vā temāsaṃ pacchimaṃ vā temāsaṃ avasitvā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.6.eng: not having stayed put for the first three or the last three months of the rainy season.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.8.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.8.eng: when the villages are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next village she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.9.pli: Agāmake araññe addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.9.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.1.9.comm: “Six kilometers” renders addhayojana, “half a yojana”. For further discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.2.2.eng: if she goes on seven-day business;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.2.3.eng: if she goes because something is disturbing her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc39:2.2.7.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā purāṇarājorodhā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.2.eng: At that time a woman who had previously belonged to the king’s harem had gone forth as a nun.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.3.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī anabhiratiyā pīḷitā yena sā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.3.eng: Another nun who was plagued by lust went to that nun and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.4.eng: “Venerable, the king only came to you at long intervals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.8.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī tassā bhikkhuniyā jatumaṭṭhakaṃ ācikkhi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.8.eng: That nun described a dildo to her.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.9.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī jatumaṭṭhakaṃ ādiyitvā dhovituṃ vissaritvā ekamantaṃ chaḍḍesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.9.eng: The other nun then used a dildo. But she forgot to wash it before disposing of it in a certain place.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.10.eng: The nuns saw it covered with flies, and they said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.13.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.13.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.14.eng: “How could a nun use a dildo?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.15.eng: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.18.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhunī jatumaṭṭhakaṃ ādiyissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.18.eng: “How could a nun use a dildo?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.21.1.eng: ‘If a nun uses a dildo, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:1.21.1.comm: Sp 2.807: Jatumaṭṭhaketi jatunā kate maṭṭhadaṇḍake, “Jatumaṭṭhake: a polished rod made of resin.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.2.eng: made of resin, made of wood, made of flour, made of clay.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.4.pli: samphassaṃ sādiyantī antamaso uppalapattampi muttakaraṇaṃ paveseti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.4.eng: if she consents to the contact and inserts it into her vagina, even if it is just a lotus leaf, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.6.eng: if she does it because she is sick;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc4:2.9.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:0.5.eng: The training rule on going wandering

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo tattheva rājagahe vassaṃ vasanti, tattha hemantaṃ, tattha gimhaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns were staying right there at Rājagaha for the rainy season, the winter, and the summer.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.4.pli: “āhundarikā bhikkhunīnaṃ disā andhakārā, na imāsaṃ disā pakkhāyantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.4.eng: “The nuns are leaving the districts in darkness and obscurity. They don’t brighten them up by their presence.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.6.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.7.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.8.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.8.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.9.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.9.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the nuns for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.10.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.11.eng: for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.12.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.12.eng: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.13.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī vassaṃvuṭṭhā cārikaṃ na pakkameyya antamaso chappañcayojanānipi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.13.1.eng: ‘If a nun who has completed the rainy-season residence does not go wandering at least 65 to 80 kilometers, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:1.13.1.comm: That is, five or six yojanas. For further discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.5.eng: Who has completed the rainy-season residence:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.6.pli: purimaṃ vā temāsaṃ pacchimaṃ vā temāsaṃ vuṭṭhā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.6.eng: who has completed the first three or the last three months of the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.7.pli: “Cārikaṃ na pakkamissāmi antamaso chappañcayojanānipī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.1.7.eng: If she thinks, “I won’t go wandering, not even 65 to 80 kilometers,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.2.3.eng: if she searches for a companion nun, but is unable to find one;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.2.8.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc40:2.2.9.eng: The fourth subchapter on lying down is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.13.eng: “How could the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī rājāgāraṃ vā cittāgāraṃ vā ārāmaṃ vā uyyānaṃ vā pokkharaṇiṃ vā dassanāya gaccheyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun visits a royal house or a pleasure house or a park or a garden or a lotus pond, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.6.pli: yattha katthaci rañño kīḷituṃ ramituṃ kataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.6.eng: wherever one has been built for a king to entertain and enjoy himself.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.8.pli: yattha katthaci manussānaṃ kīḷituṃ ramituṃ kataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.8.eng: wherever one has been built for a people to entertain and enjoy themselves.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.10.pli: yattha katthaci manussānaṃ kīḷituṃ ramituṃ kato hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.10.eng: wherever one has been made for a people to entertain and enjoy themselves.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.12.pli: yattha katthaci manussānaṃ kīḷituṃ ramituṃ kataṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.12.eng: wherever one has been made for a people to entertain and enjoy themselves.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.14.pli: yattha katthaci manussānaṃ kīḷituṃ ramituṃ katā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.14.eng: wherever one has been made for a people to entertain and enjoy themselves.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.14.comm: The usual meaning of pokkharaṇī as “lotus pond” is well established in the suttas. Much of the time they seem to have been decorative, but there are few instances in the Vinaya where they are used for washing, such as in Mahākhandhaka, the Great Chapter, where the Buddha washes a cloth in a pokkharaṇī (Kd 1:20.1.4). In fact, this distinction in use is reflected in the commentaries, which speak of nahāna-pokkharaṇī, “pokkharaṇi for bathing”, and kīḷana-pokkharaṇi, “pokkharaṇi for playing”. Because pokkharaṇis were given to monasteries “for the benefit of the Sangha” (Kd 15:17.2.1), they were probably meant for bathing and washing, not just for decoration. Moreover, it seems the pokkharaṇis could be quite elaborate structures with foundations, staircases, and rails (Kd 15:17.2.1). For these reasons I vary my translation according to context, sometimes using “pond”, at other times “tank”, and sometimes adding the qualifier “lotus”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.15.eng: If she is on her way to visit them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.16.eng: Wherever she stands to see them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.17.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.17.eng: Every time she goes beyond the range of sight and then sees them again, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.18.eng: If she is on her way to visit any one of them, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.19.eng: Wherever she stands to see it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.20.pli: Dassanūpacāraṃ vijahitvā punappunaṃ passati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.1.20.eng: Every time she goes beyond the range of sight and then sees it again, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.2.2.eng: if she sees it while remaining in a monastery;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.2.3.eng: if she sees it while coming or going;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.2.4.eng: if she goes when there is something to be done and then sees it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc41:2.2.8.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo āsandimpi pallaṅkampi paribhuñjissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun uses a high or luxurious couch, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.1.6.eng: one that is oversize is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.1.8.eng: one decorated with images of predatory animals.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.1.10.eng: if she sits down or lies down on it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.2.2.eng: if she uses a high couch after cutting off the legs;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.2.3.eng: if she uses a luxurious couch after removing the decorations with images of predatory animals;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc42:2.2.6.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:0.5.eng: The training rule on spinning yarn

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo suttaṃ kantanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were spinning yarn.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo suttaṃ kantissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns spin yarn? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six spin yarn?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo suttaṃ kantantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo suttaṃ kantissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun spins yarn, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.6.eng: there are six kinds of yarn:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.7.pli: khomaṃ, kappāsikaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kambalaṃ, sāṇaṃ, bhaṅgaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.7.eng: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.7.comm: For further discussion of kappāsika, “cotton”, and bhaṅga, “hemp”, see Appendix of Plants, in volume 2 of this series.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.9.eng: if she spins it herself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.10.eng: For every pull, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.1.10.comm: Sp 2.988: Ujjavujjaveti yattakaṁ hatthena añchitaṁ hoti, tasmiṁ takkamhi veṭhite ekā āpatti, “Ujjavujjava: however much is pulled by hand, there is one offense when the spindle is turned.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.2.eng: if she spins yarn that has already been spun;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc43:2.2.5.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:0.5.eng: The training rule on providing services for householders

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo gihiveyyāvaccaṃ karonti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.2.eng: the nuns were providing services for householders.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.4.eng: “How can nuns provide services for householders?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo gihiveyyāvaccaṃ karissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun provides services for a householder, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.6.pli: agārikassa yāguṃ vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā pacati, sāṭakaṃ vā veṭhanaṃ vā dhovati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.1.6.eng: if she cooks congee, a meal, or fresh food for a householder, or she washes a wrap garment or a turban for them, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.2.eng: if it is a congee drink;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.3.eng: if it is a meal for the Sangha;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.4.eng: if it is to venerate a shrine;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.5.pli: attano veyyāvaccakarassa yāguṃ vā bhattaṃ vā khādanīyaṃ vā pacati, sāṭakaṃ vā veṭhanaṃ vā dhovati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.5.eng: if she cooks congee, a meal, or fresh food for her own service-provider, or she washes a wrap garment or a turban for them;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc44:2.2.8.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.
